post_text: Current Falcon Pride Members (yes that includes our outstanding new freshmen!), the time has come where I get to share the good news! It’s time for marching band to start! I hope you are as excited as I am to get started! We are going to use common sense, take additional precautions in this delicate time to protect each one of you and your families, and we are going to begin our 2020 marching season! I order for this to happen, we need to get information to you... July 1, 2020 we need students and/or parents to pick up a packet of information at the Band Practice Lot (by the tower) between 5 and 7:30pm. There is some paperwork that must be completed and returned at our first rehearsal July 16 6:00-7:30pm. This Wednesday July 1, Just drive up, pick your packet up, and you are free to go. You can then call, email, text, etc any questions you have. I can’t wait to see you Wednesday, and I’m so excited to begin our season together! To our current JGHS Band students, it looks like the Indy 500 will run in August rather than Memorial Day weekend. I’m so sorry that we will not be making this trip this year.

To all the drum corps participants, alums, and fans in our band family, I’m so sorry that the 2020 season was cancelled. I am confident that 2021 will be the best season yet!

Just goes to show you that we should appreciate the opportunities we have when we have them. We can choose to be upset about the opportunities missed, or we can choose to reflect fondly on the opportunities we’ve had and look forward to the wonderful opportunities we will have when this is all over. We each get to choose for ourselves how we react to the things happening around us. I’m looking forward to all of the opportunities we will share after this is all over, and I think we will all appreciate the opportunities and each other a little more as we move forward together!

Take care, and we’ll see you all soon!

The Falcon Pride was ready to give an outstanding show today! We had a great rehearsal this morning. As we were ready to perform, The Fire Chief shut down the outdoor performances this afternoon for class C. Because we had so many students involved in events for Falloween, show choir, and soccer games, we didn't really have the option to wait around to find out if and when they were going to have an indoor show.

As we were packing up, almost ready to go, they announced that they were going to do an indoor show for class C. This was not an option for our group today given the time constraints.

We made the decision to protect our wonderful young people today. We made the decision to be a team player and continue to build and maintain positive relationships with our choirs and athletes at our school. I believe we decided to do what was in the best interest of our kids.

Thank you everyone for your maturity and understanding as we (including our hosts) had to make some difficult decisions today.

We can all be proud of the Falcon Pride today!
